name: Adelynn's Jungle Memory Safari
description: A fun and educational jungle animal memory matching game for children. Help Adelynn discover and learn about jungle animals by matching pairs of animal cards!
author: Bradley Virtual Solutions, LLC

animals.name: Bengal Tiger
animals.fact: Bengal tigers are the largest cats in the world and can weigh up to 500 pounds! They have unique stripe patterns, just like human fingerprints.

animals.name: African Elephant
animals.fact: African elephants are the largest land mammals and can live up to 70 years! They use their trunks like a hand to pick up objects.

animals.name: Spider Monkey
animals.fact: Spider monkeys have the longest tails of any primate and use them like a fifth limb! They can swing through trees at amazing speeds.

animals.name: Scarlet Macaw
animals.fact: Scarlet macaws can live up to 50 years and are excellent mimics! They can learn to say over 100 different words.

animals.name: Jaguar
animals.fact: Jaguars have the strongest bite of any big cat and can crush turtle shells! They are excellent swimmers and love water.

animals.name: Toucan
animals.fact: Toucans use their large beaks to reach fruit on thin branches! Their beaks are actually very light despite their size.

animals.name: Crocodile
animals.fact: Crocodiles have been around for over 200 million years - they're living dinosaurs! They can go months without eating.

animals.name: Hippopotamus
animals.fact: Hippos can hold their breath for up to 5 minutes underwater! Despite their size, they can run faster than humans on land.

animals.name: Anaconda
animals.fact: Anacondas are the heaviest snakes in the world and can grow up to 30 feet long! They can eat prey larger than their own heads.

animals.name: Poison Dart Frog
animals.fact: Poison dart frogs get their poison from the insects they eat in the wild! Their bright colors warn predators they're dangerous.

animals.name: Morpho Butterfly
animals.fact: Morpho butterflies have iridescent blue wings that shimmer in the sunlight! They taste with their feet instead of their mouths.

animals.name: Sloth
animals.fact: Sloths move so slowly that algae grows on their fur, giving them a green color! They only come down from trees once a week.

animals.name: Giraffe
animals.fact: Giraffes are the tallest animals on Earth and can grow up to 18 feet tall! Their tongues are 20 inches long and blue-black in color.

animals.name: Zebra
animals.fact: Every zebra has a unique stripe pattern, just like human fingerprints! Their stripes help confuse predators when they run in groups.

animals.name: Lion
animals.fact: Lions are the only cats that live in groups called prides! A lion's roar can be heard from 5 miles away.

animals.name: Cheetah
animals.fact: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals and can run up to 70 mph! They can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 3 seconds.

animals.name: Rhinoceros
animals.fact: Rhinos have thick skin that can be up to 2 inches thick! Despite their size, they can run up to 30 mph.

animals.name: Gazelle
animals.fact: Gazelles can run up to 60 mph and jump 10 feet high! They have excellent eyesight and can spot predators from far away.

animals.name: Antelope
animals.fact: Antelopes have hollow horns that never stop growing! They can run up to 50 mph to escape from predators.

animals.name: Wildebeest
animals.fact: Wildebeests migrate in herds of over 1 million animals! They travel over 1,000 miles each year in search of food and water.

animals.name: African Buffalo
animals.fact: African buffaloes are one of the most dangerous animals in Africa! They have never been successfully domesticated.

animals.name: Warthog
animals.fact: Warthogs can run up to 30 mph and have tusks that can grow up to 10 inches long! They kneel on their front legs to eat.

animals.name: Meerkat
animals.fact: Meerkats always have a sentry on guard duty! They take turns watching for predators while others forage for food.

animals.name: Mongoose
animals.fact: Mongooses are immune to snake venom! They can fight and kill cobras that are much larger than themselves.

animals.name: Hyena
animals.fact: Hyenas have the strongest bite force of any mammal! Their laugh-like calls can be heard from 3 miles away.

animals.name: Jackal
animals.fact: Jackals are excellent hunters and can run up to 40 mph! They often hunt in pairs and share their food.

animals.name: Fennec Fox
animals.fact: Fennec foxes have the largest ears relative to their body size! Their ears help them hear prey underground and stay cool.

animals.name: Fruit Bat
animals.fact: Fruit bats are the only mammals that can truly fly! They use echolocation to navigate in the dark.

animals.name: Ring-tailed Lemur
animals.fact: Ring-tailed lemurs use their tails to communicate! They wave their striped tails to show dominance and mark territory.

animals.name: Baboon
animals.fact: Baboons have cheek pouches to store food while foraging! They can carry up to 20% of their body weight in their cheeks.

animals.name: Chimpanzee
animals.fact: Chimpanzees share 98% of their DNA with humans! They use tools like sticks to fish for termites.

animals.name: Gorilla
animals.fact: Gorillas are the largest primates and can weigh up to 400 pounds! They build nests in trees to sleep at night.

animals.name: Orangutan
animals.fact: Orangutans are the largest tree-dwelling animals! They spend 90% of their time in trees and rarely come down.

animals.name: Bald Eagle
animals.fact: Bald eagles can see fish from 2 miles away! They can dive at speeds of up to 100 mph to catch their prey.

animals.name: Great Horned Owl
animals.fact: Owls can turn their heads 270 degrees! They have excellent night vision and can hear a mouse from 100 feet away.

animals.name: Flamingo
animals.fact: Flamingos get their pink color from the shrimp they eat! They can stand on one leg for hours without getting tired.

animals.name: Pelican
animals.fact: Pelicans can hold up to 3 gallons of water in their beak pouches! They use their pouches like fishing nets.

animals.name: Peacock
animals.fact: Peacocks can grow up to 200 feathers in their tail! They use their colorful feathers to attract mates.

animals.name: Hummingbird
animals.fact: Hummingbirds can fly backwards and hover in place! Their wings beat up to 80 times per second.

animals.name: Woodpecker
animals.fact: Woodpeckers can peck up to 20 times per second! Their skulls have special shock absorbers to protect their brains.

animals.name: Sea Turtle
animals.fact: Sea turtles can live up to 100 years! They return to the same beach where they were born to lay their eggs.

animals.name: Chameleon
animals.fact: Chameleons can change color in just 20 seconds! They have eyes that can move independently of each other.

animals.name: Gecko
animals.fact: Geckos can walk on walls and ceilings! They have millions of tiny hairs on their feet that create molecular forces.

animals.name: Iguana
animals.fact: Iguanas can grow up to 6 feet long! They can drop their tails to escape from predators and grow new ones.

animals.name: Salamander
animals.fact: Salamanders can regenerate lost limbs! They can grow back arms, legs, and even parts of their hearts.

animals.name: Newt
animals.fact: Newts can live up to 20 years! They have bright colors to warn predators that they're poisonous.

animals.name: Toad
animals.fact: Toads can live up to 40 years! They have bumpy skin and can inflate themselves to look bigger when threatened.

animals.name: Honeybee
animals.fact: Honeybees can fly up to 15 mph! They visit up to 2,000 flowers per day to collect nectar and pollen.

animals.name: Dragonfly
animals.fact: Dragonflies can fly up to 35 mph! They have been around for over 300 million years and are excellent hunters.

animals.name: Ladybug
animals.fact: Ladybugs can eat up to 5,000 aphids in their lifetime! They are considered good luck in many cultures.

animals.name: Jumping Spider
animals.fact: Jumping spiders can jump up to 50 times their body length! They have excellent vision and can see in color.

animals.name: Scorpion
animals.fact: Scorpions can glow under ultraviolet light! They can survive without food for up to a year.

animals.name: Penguin
animals.fact: Penguins can swim up to 22 mph underwater! They can hold their breath for up to 20 minutes while diving.

animals.name: Seal
animals.fact: Seals can hold their breath for up to 2 hours! They can dive up to 1,000 feet deep in search of food.

animals.name: Dolphin
animals.fact: Dolphins are one of the smartest animals on Earth! They use echolocation to find food and communicate with each other.

animals.name: Humpback Whale
animals.fact: Humpback whales can grow up to 60 feet long! They sing complex songs that can be heard from 20 miles away.

animals.name: Great White Shark
animals.fact: Great white sharks can detect a drop of blood in 25 gallons of water! They can swim up to 35 mph.

animals.name: Octopus
animals.fact: Octopuses have 3 hearts and blue blood! They can change color and texture to blend in with their surroundings.

animals.name: Jellyfish
animals.fact: Jellyfish have been around for over 500 million years! They don't have brains, hearts, or bones.

animals.name: Starfish
animals.fact: Starfish can regenerate lost arms! They can grow back an entire arm if it gets cut off.

animals.name: Crab
animals.fact: Crabs can walk sideways faster than forwards! They have 10 legs and can regenerate lost claws.

animals.name: Lobster
animals.fact: Lobsters can live up to 100 years! They can grow new claws if they lose one in a fight.

animals.name: Seahorse
animals.fact: Seahorses are the only animals where the male gives birth! They can change color to match their surroundings.
